bibl.title: Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro v. State of Washington. Service of Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: United States of America, Western District of Washington} ss:

I hereby certify and return that I served the annexe Writ of Habeas Corpus on the therein-named Joseph R.H. Jacoby, United States Marshal of the Western District of Washington by handing to and leaving a true and correct copy thereof with Joseph R.H. Jacoby personally at Seattle, Wn in said District on the 20th day of June A.D. 1913.
Copy of within received and due service of the same acknowledged this day of 191 Attorney for
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Jul 9 1913 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, By EML Deputy.

Service of all subsequent papers in the within named action, except writs and process may be made upon by serving the same upon Wardall, Wardall & Martin, as for said 540-1-2 New York Block, Seattle, Washington.
for said
In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro alias B.K. Sugiuro for a writ of habeas corpus.
In the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington by Red 7/2/13 at US attys match
Wardall, Wardall & Martin Attorneys for petitioners for 540-1-2 New York Block Seattle Main 7465
